mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Creates a process in suspended mode (likely to inject code)
Uses netsh to modify the Windows network and firewall settings
Queries the volume information (name, serial number etc) of a device
Uses ipconfig to modify the Windows network settings
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Executes the "systemctl" command used for controlling the systemd system and service manager
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Tries to detect Cloud Protection Platforms agents (likely to circumvent detection)
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Executes the "ps" command used to list the status of processes
Reads system information from the proc file system
Reads CPU information from /sys indicative of miner or evasive malware

Executes the "ps" command used to list the status of processes
Tries to detect Cloud Protection Platforms agents (likely to circumvent detection)
Executes the "grep" command used to find patterns in files or piped streams

processes_tree.name: C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /c C:\Windows\System32\netsh.exe interface ip delete arpcache >C:\Windows\TEMP\ipconfig.out 2>&1
